Authors: Hamali S., Nurfanka A.G.R., Firdausi A.M., Setiawati M.S.
Title: Evaluation of the delayed fiber optical installation project on pre-sales division at PT XYZ
Source title: IOP Conference Series: Earth and Environmental Science
Affiliations: Management Department, BINUS Business School Undergraduate Program, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. K.H. Syahdan No. 9, Palmerah, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Management Department, BINUS Business School Master Program, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. Hang Lekir I No.6, Jakarta, 10270, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Hamali, S., Management Department, BINUS Business School Undergraduate Program, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. K.H. Syahdan No. 9, Palmerah, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Nurfanka, A.G.R., Management Department, BINUS Business School Undergraduate Program, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. K.H. Syahdan No. 9, Palmerah, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Firdausi, A.M., Management Department, BINUS Business School Undergraduate Program, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. K.H. Syahdan No. 9, Palmerah, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Setiawati, M.S., Management Department, BINUS Business School Master Program, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. Hang Lekir I No.6, Jakarta, 10270, Indonesia
Abstract: This study aims to identify the causes of delays of the project, to know the duration of time of completion and critical paths of the project, and acceleration time as well as the cost of Fiber Optic Installation Project on Pre-Sales division at PT XYZ. The research method used is Mixed Method, and the direct interview is used for data collecting method. Furthermore, The analysis methods that are used in this research are Cause and Effect Diagram Method as an analysis tool to identify the factors that cause delays, especially on the service industry. Critical Path Method (CPM) is used to identify which activities are included in Critical Path, which can shorten its duration by using Crashing Project with POM-QM as an analysis tool. The research resulted there are four factors that cause delays which are System, Skill, Supplier, Surrounding. The project can be completed within eighty-one days. The project can also be completed within seventy-eight days within the consideration of additional hours for an hour per day, and acceleration cost added. From the results of this study, the company will able to find out the causes of delays in the service industry that have an impact on project delays. © Published under licence by IOP Publishing Ltd.
Index Keywords: Turnaround time; Acceleration time; Analysis method; Cause-and-Effect diagram; Causes of delays; Critical path method; Data collecting; Project delays; research methods; Service industry

Authors: Hamali S., Prihandoko D., Kurniawan S., Ramdhani R.
Title: The effects of supply chain information integration on organizational performance in food small industry
Affiliations: Department of Management, BINUS Business School Undergraduate Program, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Hamali, S., Department of Management, BINUS Business School Undergraduate Program, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Prihandoko, D., Department of Management, BINUS Business School Undergraduate Program, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Kurniawan, S., Department of Management, BINUS Business School Undergraduate Program, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Ramdhani, R., Department of Management, BINUS Business School Undergraduate Program, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: This study aims to examine the effect of supply chain information integration consisting of internal and external Information Integration on organizational performance, which consists of customer satisfaction, supply chain performance, and financial performance. The technique of collecting data is based on a questionnaire distributed to 185 small food industry owners. Methods of data analysis is based on using SEM-PLS. The results show that internal information integration affected customer satisfaction, supply chain, and financial performance. External information integration is proven to have a non-linear effect on customer satisfaction and on the performance of the supply chain. Customer satisfaction and supply chain performance affect financial performance. Internal information integration is more dominant and plays an important role in increasing the performance of the organization. © 2020 by the authors; licensee Growing Science, Canada.
Author Keywords: Customer Satisfaction; External Information Integration; Financial Performance; Internal Information Integration; Supply Chain Performance
Funding Text 1: The authors want to thank Bina Nusantara University. This research is supported by the Research Fellowship Bina Nusantara University, the year 2019.

Authors: Hidayat C., Ramadhan M.R., Rilamsyah A., Abdillah F., Hamali S.
Title: The Role of Supply Chain Integration on Information Sharing and its impact on the Supply Chain Performance (The Study on Beverage Distribution Company)
Source title: Proceedings of 2019 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2019
Affiliations: Management Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Hidayat, C., Management Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Ramadhan, M.R., Management Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Rilamsyah, A., Management Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Abdillah, F., Management Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Hamali, S., Management Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: The intention of this study is to know the effect of supplier, internal, and customer integration on the performance of the supply chain through information sharing at PT. X. The study method used is quantitative method by collecting data through questionnaire. The data analysis uses Warp Partial Least Square version 5.0. These results show that supplier and internal integration have no effect on supply chain performance. Supplier, internal, and costumer integration affect the information sharing. Customer and information sharing have an effect on supply chain performance. The current result conclusion is that managers need to improve customer integration and information sharing. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: Hamali S., Hidayat C., Shadrina A.W.N., Pramesti A.A., Handoyo F.F.
Title: Improving Warehouse Layout and Allocation Optimization in Catering Services Company
Source title: Proceedings of 2019 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2019
Affiliations: Management Department, BINUS Business School Undergraduate Program, Bina Nusantara University Jakarta, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Hamali, S., Management Department, BINUS Business School Undergraduate Program, Bina Nusantara University Jakarta, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Hidayat, C., Management Department, BINUS Business School Undergraduate Program, Bina Nusantara University Jakarta, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Shadrina, A.W.N., Management Department, BINUS Business School Undergraduate Program, Bina Nusantara University Jakarta, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Pramesti, A.A., Management Department, BINUS Business School Undergraduate Program, Bina Nusantara University Jakarta, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Handoyo, F.F., Management Department, BINUS Business School Undergraduate Program, Bina Nusantara University Jakarta, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: This study aims to find out and provide suggestions about improving the layout and optimizing product placement allocation for the inventories in the warehouse of a catering services company. The method used in this study is quantitative research methods and the type of research is descriptive research. The data collection method using observations and interviews, and the data characteristic are primary and secondary data. Time Horizon in this study using a cross-sectional. Data analysis used ABC Class-Based and Linear Programming method with LINGO Software version 18.0. The results of research conducted at PT Aerofood ACS warehouse is product classification using ABC Class-Based. The products are divided into three classes, class A namely rice, and monouse, class B are soy sauce & sauce, coconut milk, and milk, and class C are tissue, sugar, and tea. For product placement allocation using Transportation method with Linear Programming approach. The results obtained are changes in the space used to store all products. The smaller overall number of pallets and shelves that should visit affects the length of time taken to collect the products. Based on these results, managers should use the ABC Class-Based and Transportation methods for optimizing allocations at a catering services company. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: ABC class-based; linear programming; warehouse; warehouse layout
Index Keywords: Information management; Linear programming; Warehouses; Allocation optimization; Class-based; Data characteristics; Data collection method; Product classification; Quantitative research methods; Transportation method; Warehouse layout; C (programming language)

Authors: Jong C.H., Medina N., Fakhriyah N., Hidayat C., Hamali S.
Title: Using Goal Programming Method for Optimization of Production Planning
Source title: Proceedings of 2018 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2018
Affiliations: Management Department, Bina Nusantara University, BINUS Business School Undergraduate Program, Jakarta, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Jong, C.H., Management Department, Bina Nusantara University, BINUS Business School Undergraduate Program, Jakarta, Indonesia; Medina, N., Management Department, Bina Nusantara University, BINUS Business School Undergraduate Program, Jakarta, Indonesia; Fakhriyah, N., Management Department, Bina Nusantara University, BINUS Business School Undergraduate Program, Jakarta, Indonesia; Hidayat, C., Management Department, Bina Nusantara University, BINUS Business School Undergraduate Program, Jakarta, Indonesia; Hamali, S., Management Department, Bina Nusantara University, BINUS Business School Undergraduate Program, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: Manufacturing industry business is one of the industries which has significant development therefore it's important to maintain quality and the efficiency of working time in order to meet customer's demand. One way to achieve company's objectives is by optimization process production without reducing the quality of the product. Therefore, the purpose of this research is to maximize production volume for providing customer's demands, maximize sales revenue, minimize production cost and maximize machine's working hour cost. The method used in this research is Goal Programming without priority and with weighted priority and applied to LINGO software version 17. From the calculation of the two methods of Goal Programming, Goal Programming method without priority is the most optimal for production planning at PT XYZ, because it can improve the efficiency for machine's working hours and production cost, thus the sales revenue increased by 404.69%. It will affect and give a good impact on the company for business development. As a result, this research showed that the define objectives achieved optimally. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: goal programming manufacturing industry; optimization production process planning

Authors: Widayanti R.E., Adany C., Zahra N.M., Sanandra R.F., Hamali S.
Title: The Effect of Dimension of Supply Chain Integration on Schedule Attainment and Competitive Performance (Case Study in PT 'X')
Source title: Proceedings of 2018 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2018
Affiliations: Management Department, Bina Nusantara University, BINUS Business School Undergraduate Program, Jakarta, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Widayanti, R.E., Management Department, Bina Nusantara University, BINUS Business School Undergraduate Program, Jakarta, Indonesia; Adany, C., Management Department, Bina Nusantara University, BINUS Business School Undergraduate Program, Jakarta, Indonesia; Zahra, N.M., Management Department, Bina Nusantara University, BINUS Business School Undergraduate Program, Jakarta, Indonesia; Sanandra, R.F., Management Department, Bina Nusantara University, BINUS Business School Undergraduate Program, Jakarta, Indonesia; Hamali, S., Management Department, Bina Nusantara University, BINUS Business School Undergraduate Program, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: This research aims to determine the influence of the supply chain integration (SCI) dimensions, ie integration of supplier, internal and customer on schedule attainment (SA) and competitive performance (CP), the research method used is quantitative research, the type of research used is associative by spreading questionnaire. The data analysis method is using SEM-PLS with WarpPLS 5.0. The findings demonstrate that there is an effect on internal integration and customer integration against schedule attainment, and no effect on the integration of supplier. Meanwhile, integration of supplier has an influence on competitive performance, while integration of supplier and integration of internal has no effect. As a result, to gain schedule attainment, the manager should improve the integration of internal and customer. Other than that, to enhance the CP, the CI also must be increased. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: competitive performance; customer integration; internal integration; schedule attainment; supplier integration

Title: A six sigma application for the reduction of floor covering defects
Source title: Pertanika Journal of Social Sciences and Humanities

Syahdan No. 9, Kemanggisan/Palmerah, Jakarta Barat, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Quality of a product is a key to improving a company’s competitiveness. PT. “X” is a company engaged in plastic waste processing. It converts the waste into a floor carpet. The purpose of this study was to determine the number of sigma levels generated by PT. “X” in producing Floor covering, what caused the defects and how to reduce defective products using Six Sigma methods based on DMAIC step. Data for the study was collected from interviews and production statistics. The results showed the level of product quality was sigma 3.67, which is an average industry standard for Indonesia. Further, it was found that man (worker) is the major factor for occurrence of defective products. Therefore, a new employment policy at PT. “X” is needed. © Universiti Putra Malaysia Press.
Author Keywords: Defective products; DMAIC; Quality control; Six Sigma

Authors: Hamali S., Suci R.P.N., Utami A.F., Hanisman, Arga F.
Title: Using analytic hierarchy process and Decision Tree for a production decision making
Source title: Proceedings of 2016 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2016
Affiliations: School of Business and Management, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; PhD Candidate in Economics, University of Illinois at Urbana Champaign, Illinois, United States
Authors with affiliations: Hamali, S., School of Business and Management, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Suci, R.P.N., School of Business and Management, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Utami, A.F., School of Business and Management, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Hanisman, School of Business and Management, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Arga, F., PhD Candidate in Economics, University of Illinois at Urbana Champaign, Illinois, United States
Abstract: Today, the light weight bricks are on high demand in the market, where 'X' is considering to expand its' business to produce this product. However, expanding business to a new business lines requires a comprehensive considerations. Complexity of decision-making not only lies in the uncertainty or the imperfections of information, but involves many criteria and sub-criteria used to rank the alternatives of a decision. The purpose of this study is to understand the best solution on whether or not the light weight bricks being produced by 'X'. Hence, this study applied the analytic hierarchy process (AHP) and Decision Tree Analysis (DTA) as the rational decision making tools may help 'X' to decide whether or not to invest in the new business line. The results based on data processing AHP of directors and general managers indicate that the 'X' has a tendency to decide to make the light weight bricks. While based on the DTA shows that the 'X' will benefit if it decides to make the light weight bricks. © 2016 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Analytic Hierarchy Process; Decision Tree Analysis; Expected Monetary Value; Light weight bricks; Multi-criteria
Index Keywords: Analytic hierarchy process; Brick; Data handling; Decision trees; Hierarchical systems; Information management; Analytic hierarchy process (ahp); Decision tree analysis; Expanding business; Expected monetary values; Light weight; Multi-criteria; Production decisions; Rational decision making; Decision making

Authors: Sarjono H., Kusuma V., Hamali S., Mulyono
Title: Planning production capacity Optimisation with rough cut capacity planning
Source title: Pertanika Journal of Social Sciences and Humanities
Affiliations: Department of Management, School of Business Management, Binus University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Sarjono, H., Department of Management, School of Business Management, Binus University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Kusuma, V., Department of Management, School of Business Management, Binus University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Hamali, S., Department of Management, School of Business Management, Binus University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Mulyono, Department of Management, School of Business Management, Binus University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: PT. XYZ is a manufacturing company that produces polyethylene plastic. In some periods, the company is not able to meet consumer demand as requests exceed available production capacity. This study aims to determine the work centre that is experiencing a shortage of production capacity and production capacity planning is proposed as an alternative work centre to optimise production capacity at minimal cost using Rough Cut Capacity Planning (RCCP). This type of research is descriptive. Data was collected through interviews and observations and used to perform capacity planning, i.e.The company's policy of data, company resource data, cost data, and historical demand data. Data processing begins with forecasting consumer demand while RCCP is used to determine the work centre that is experiencing a shortage of production capacity. The proposed production capacity is used as an alternative work centre in increasing production capacity. The results from this study, including the estimated plastic demand for the coming 12 months are 434 766 Kg; There are four work centres that are experiencing a shortage of production capacity at the company, which is cutting manual work centre, work centre cutting machines, sealing work centre and work centre printing; fulfilment capacity planning alternative is a recommendation that is considered to be the most optimal. The results of the proposed production capacity planning show that all estimates of consumer demand can be met and will increase the company's revenue by 31.54%.
Author Keywords: Capacity Planning; Capacity Shortage; Forecasting; Production Capacity; Rough Cut Capacity Planning
References: Angalakuditi, J.B., Kurnool, R.G., Decision support system (DSS) for capacity planning: A case study (2013) International Journal of Advance Research in Computer Science and Management Studies, 1 (4), pp. 24-30; Gaspersz, V., (2005) Production Planning and Inventory Control, , Jakarta: Gramedia Pustaka Utama; Harrison, F., (2011) Supply Chain Management Workbook, , USA: Butterworth-Heinemann; Hutagalung, I.R., Rambe, A.J.M., Nazlina, M.T., Perencanaan kebutuhan kapasitas produksi pada PT.
